greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 7^n mod 31.
comment: Sequence is periodic with period length of 15. That a(15) = 1 means that 31 is not prime in Z[sqrt(7)], being factorable as (-1)*(9 - 4*sqrt(7))(9 + 4*sqrt(7)). - _Alonso del Arte_, Oct 11 2012
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
program: (Sage) [power_mod(7,n,31) for n in range(0,82)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 27 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 12 2002
